abstract: Regulators are trying to clamp down on rogue traders like JPMorgan Chase’s Bruno Iksil, nicknamed the London Whale, who amassed large positions in credit derivatives as part of a complex trading strategy that eventually soured.
snippet: Regulators are trying to clamp down on rogue traders like JPMorgan Chase’s Bruno Iksil, nicknamed the London Whale, who amassed large positions in credit derivatives as part of a complex trading strategy that eventually soured.
lead_paragraph: Bank regulators are casting new nets to catch excessive risk-taking in the financial system. But future London Whales may find plenty of ways to slip right through them.

headline.print_headline: News Analysis: Loopholes Abound Despite New Rules

abstract: Jamie Dimon is sticking to a similar script: once again, he will apologize for his bank’s huge trading loss while playing down its effect on JPMorgan Chase and the broader financial system.
snippet: Jamie Dimon is sticking to a similar script: once again, he will apologize for his bank’s huge trading loss while playing down its effect on JPMorgan Chase and the broader financial system.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the outspoken chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, is returning to Washington to face another round of questions about his bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss.

headline.main: Regulators Join Dimon at House Panel Hearing
headline.print_headline: Regulators Join Dimon At House Panel Hearing

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s chairman and chief executive answered more questions on Capitol Hill about his firm’s huge trading loss, this time before the House Committee on Financial Services.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s chairman and chief executive answered more questions on Capitol Hill about his firm’s huge trading loss, this time before the House Committee on Financial Services.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon was back in the hot seat on Tuesday.

headline.main: Live Blog: House Panel Hearing on JPMorgan

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: With regulators at the witness table in the House hearing on JPMorgan’s trading losses, Democrats and Republicans traded barbs over Dodd-Frank, the financial regulatory overhaul.
snippet: With regulators at the witness table in the House hearing on JPMorgan’s trading losses, Democrats and Republicans traded barbs over Dodd-Frank, the financial regulatory overhaul.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon and his regulators visited Capitol Hill on Tuesday for another round of scrutiny for a recent multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: Lawmakers Clash on Regulation at JPMorgan Hearing
